result.execSummary:
The defendant Regina M. Walker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Full Huber, Stayed-Defendant to call Diversion Office 373-3880 M-F 7am-3pm within 72 working hours or by October 19 2022  for report date within 60 days or no later than December 13 2022. Failure to do so will result in issuance of a commitment to jail without huber privileges and new criminal charges.
Concurrent with: Count two and 22CT240

records.addlTxt: 11:54 AM Defendant Regina M. Walker in court.  Attorney Kelly J. Freeman in court for Regina M. Walker.  Prosecuting attorney David S Olson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads guilty to both counts. Court finds the defendant guilty. Court orders 45 days Jail on each count concurrent with each other and 22CT240 with Full Huber and Diversion, defendant to contact diversion by October 19 2022 and report no later than December 13 2022. Court costs due December 16 2022.  0 Days credit.

1:25 PM Defendant Regina M. Walker in court.  Attorney Kelly J. Freeman in court for Regina M. Walker.  Attorney Noah M Tylenda in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Activity: Status conference
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

09:41 AM Prosecuting attorney David S Olson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Regina M. Walker appeared by video.  Attorney Kelly J. Freeman appeared by video for Regina M. Walker. Defendant to contact Public Defenders Office to have attorney Freeman appointed on case.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Status conference on July 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Activity:Return on warrant 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

02:07 PM Defendant Regina M. Walker in court by video.  Kyle Edward Johnson  and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Vacate warrant. Previous bond reinstated. Defendant pleads not guilty, jury trial to be set.
appeared in court by video. Original Warrant returned June 10, 2022

Activity: non appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.
10:22 AM Defendant Regina M. Walker not in court.  Noah M Tylenda appeared by video  for the State of Wisconsin. Bench warrant $250.00 cash ordered on defendants non appearance.
Cannot operate a motor vehicle during pendency of case without valid drivers license or without valid insurance.

Activity: initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

10:01 AM Defendant Regina M. Walker in court appearing  by video.  Noah Tylenda appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Warrant ordered at 8:34 am is vacated, defendant appeared late after court reporter was already out of courtroom. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, address verified, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Signature bond set of $500.00  with conditions.   Cannot operate a motor vehicle during pendency of case without valid drivers license or without valid insurance. Must sign bond Wednesday, May 25, 2022 between noon and 1 pm. Matter continued to allow defendant time to obtain an attorney.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on May 19, 2022 at 08:00 am.
